gameLogic

Class GameEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameLogic.GameEnvironment

  • public class GameEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains methods to run the farm game. Contains methods that allow the player's input to alter variables in the game. last modified: 20-05-2020 created:
    Author:
    Dmitri Smith, Kenn Leen Duenas Fulgencio

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameEnvironment(gameLogic.Farm farm)
      the constructor method activates the scanner that will be used to get player's input It also asks the player to input information to create a farm.

      the constructor method activates the scanner that will be used to get player's input It also asks the player to input information to create a farm.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEnvironment

        public GameEnvironment(java.lang.String farmName,
                       gameLogic.FarmType farmType,
                       gameLogic.Farmer farmer,
                       int remainingDays)
        the constructor method activates the scanner that will be used to get player's input It also asks the player to input information to create a farm.
        Parameters:
        farmName - name of farm
        farmType - Type of farm
        farmer - Farmer Object to use
        remainingDays - Number of days to play the game

      • GameEnvironment

        public GameEnvironment(gameLogic.Farm farm)
        the constructor method activates the scanner that will be used to get player's input It also asks the player to input information to create a farm.
        Parameters:
        farm - Reference to Farm object created for the game

    • Method Detail

      • Run

        public void Run()

      • tendCropMessage

        public void tendCropMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Tends to the crops then updates the detail box to tell the player about their crops. It then deletes the item used.
        Parameters:
        message - Formatted String to display to user

      • tendCrops

        public void tendCrops(gameLogic.MerchandiseWrapper selection,
                      gameLogic.Item item)

      • feedAnimals

        public void feedAnimals(gameLogic.MerchandiseWrapper selection,
                        gameLogic.Item item)
        Called by OptionalItemDialog, sends a list of chosen items and animals of the selected species.
        Parameters:
        selection - the animals the player has selected to feed.
        item - the item type the player has chosen to feed to the animal.

      • getCropStatus

        public int getCropStatus(gameLogic.Crop crop)

      • viewFarmStatus

        public void viewFarmStatus()

      • takeAction

        public void takeAction(gameLogic.PossibleAction action,
                       java.lang.String selection)
        Makes an action based on the player's input
        Parameters:
        action - PossibleAction action the player can
        selection - String name representing the .getName property of a Merchandise object

      • selectCrop

        public gameLogic.Crop selectCrop()
        Method to select a crop from all crops in the farm
        Returns:
        crop to use
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no crops are owned, or if the user cancels out of the selection
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Occurs if the user makes a selection and then the name of the selection can't be found in the crop list. Shouldn't ever happen.

      • selectActionItem

        public gameLogic.Item selectActionItem(boolean required)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Method for allowing the user to choose an item after they have chosen an action that allows/requires item use
        Parameters:
        required - WHether or not the user is required to select an item
        Returns:
        An item to use for the selected action
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the farm has no items or if the user cancels out of the selection
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Not an error, occurs when the user doesn't want to use an item AND not using an item is allowed
        java.lang.Exception - Any other exception

      • selectAnimal

        public gameLogic.Animal selectAnimal()
        Returns:
        Animal chosen by user
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the user chose no animal, or if the user cancelled out of the selection

      • endDay

        public void endDay()
        End the game day. If days remaining in game less than 1, it ends the game.

      • selectMerch

        public java.util.ArrayList<gameLogic.Merchandise> selectMerch()

      • askName

        public java.lang.String askName()
        This method asks the player to input a name.
        Returns:
        the farmer's name.

      • askAge

        public int askAge()
        Ask user to input age for farmer.
        Returns:
        farmer's age

      • askFarmType

        public gameLogic.FarmType askFarmType()
        ask player to enter a number corresponding to a type of farm.
        Returns:
        a number that represents a farmType's value

      • askDays

        public int askDays()
        Ask the player to input how many days they want to play in-game. They are restricted to only selecting between 5- 10 days.
        Returns:
        the number of days they want to play.

      • numberOnly

        public int numberOnly()
        Only returns a player's input if it is an Integer.
        Returns:
        an integer

      • isValidInput

        public java.lang.Boolean isValidInput(int playerInput)
        Contains conditions that all Integer inputs representing an action must follow.
        Parameters:
        playerInput - the integer player has typed in.
        Returns:
        True if it passes the conditions. False if it is the expected input.

      • isValidInput

        public java.lang.Boolean isValidInput(java.lang.String playerInput)
        Checks if the string-value the player entered is valid.
        Parameters:
        playerInput - Value player has typed in.
        Returns:
        True: player input fits length and type requirements.

      • showActivityScreen

        public void showActivityScreen()
        Player gets to select an activity to do. They will continue being prompted until the end of the game.

      • farmWorkScreen

        public void farmWorkScreen()
        Player can view the work they can do on the farm. Each job will cost one action. They will be prompted to input a valid number. Farmwork screen will reprint itself unless player selects return to availableActivity

      • displayGeneralStore

        public void displayGeneralStore()
        Display the General Store GUI

      • visitGeneralStore

        public void visitGeneralStore()
        Player visits the generalStore. Here they can purchase items.
